text: Consider a files system that use contiguous allocation. A file of size 50 blocks is already stored in file system. Now, consider inserting a new block in the middle of the file (between 25% and 26% block), whose data is already available in the memory. Assume that there are enough free blocks at the end of the file and that the file control block is already in memory. The number of disk accesses required to insert a block in the middle of the file is .
